examples.name: Database of Global Administrative Areas
examples.description: GADM wants to map the administrative areas of all countries, at all levels of sub-division. We use a high spatial resolution, and of a extensive set of attributes.
examples.dataLineage: Dataset was downloaded from https://gadm.org as SHP files and converted to GeoJSON.

name.title: The name schema
name.description: The human readble name of the dataset.

license.title: The license schema
license.description: A string giving the dataset licensing terms, usually a url.

url.title: The url schema
url.description: A url link to more information about the dataset.

version.title: The version schema
version.description: A string describing the dataset version.

keywords.title: The keywords schema
keywords.description: An array of keywords describing the data.

description.title: The description schema
examples: GADM wants to map the administrative areas of all countries, at all levels of sub-division. We use a high spatial resolution, and of a extensive set of attributes.

language.title: The language schema
language.description: The language of terms and properties of the dataset.

altName.title: The altName schema
altName.description: An alternative name for the dataset.

citation.title: The citation schema
citation.description: A string providing a citation for the dataset.

spatialCoverage.title: The spatialCoverage schema
spatialCoverage.description: String giving general spatial coverage of the dataset. Use unknown if not defined

temporalCoverage.title: The temporalCoverage schema
temporalCoverage.description: String giving general temporal coverage of the dataset. Use unknown if not defined

dataLineage.title: The dataLineage schema
dataLineage.description: Describe general data processing steps taken.
examples: Dataset was downloaded from https://gadm.org as SHP files and converted to GeoJSON.
